content: The Department of Housing and Urban Development plans to move forward with a measure that would permit federally funded homeless shelters to house transgender clients according to their sex assigned … [+5828 chars]
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: How wage and wealth gaps are hurting African Americans
description: White families and entrepreneurs typically have 10 times more wealth than African Americans, and African American workers on average earn 25 percent less than their white counterparts, according to recent studies. This stark economic divide dates back to slav…
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: With help of WNBA’s Maya Moore, Jonathan Irons released from prison
description: After 23 years in state prison, Jonathan Irons was released with the help of basketball superstar Maya Moore, who took a break from her WNBA career to fight for his release. Irons says he was wrongfully convicted at age 16 and his conviction was vacated in Ma…
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Trump touts 4.8 million jobs added and unemployment rate drop
description: President Trump credited his administration for the June jobs numbers, though many of the hires are furloughed workers getting their old jobs back and the tally came before coronavirus spikes forced many states to roll back reopenings.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Some states struggle to keep up with coronavirus testing demand
description: As coronavirus cases surge in some states, testing demand is soaring with as many as 600,000 tests now performed each day. Many people must wait three to four days to get their test results as labs across the country are reaching or near capacity.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Jeffrey Epstein’s alleged accomplice Ghislaine Maxwell arrested
description: Ghislaine Maxwell, longtime confidant of convicted sex offender and accused sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein, was arrested in New Hampshire. The charges include alleged crimes from the 1990s involving three minors.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Coronavirus first responders in new hot spots facing hospitals on the brink
description: Many hospitals in hard -hit Texas are nearing ICU capacity and ambulances are facing long waits before beds open up. Health care workers and first responders are also getting sick or taking extra precautions to protect their families.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: U.S. records more than 50,000 new coronavirus cases for second day
description: More than a dozen states are setting new COVID-19 records. Florida reported more than 10,000 new cases in 24 hours, Arizona is nearing ICU bed capacity and hard-hit Texas is now issuing a mandatory statewide mask policy.
source.name: NBC News

title: Nightly News: Kids Edition (July 2, 2020)
